section.title: module
section.p: A module is a collection of projects that are physically stored in a single repository.

tr.td: Override the cvs tag to be used.
Set to "true" to turn on module debugging.
mvn groupId for artifacts built by the projects contained in this module.
No, defaults to the module's name

section.title: url
section.p: This is the homepage for the collection of projects contained in this module. This element is optional, but if present, will be referenced in the generated web pages containing build results.

Note: give the way that Apache Gump uses href to specify definitions which are to be inlined, the design of this element is rather unfortunate. Perhaps it should be replaced with a <home-page> element.

tr.td: The directory (relative to the workspace's basedir) which the checked out sources are to be copied for build purposes.
No. Defaults to the name of the module.

section.title: description
section.p: If present, will contain information added to the title in web pages containing build results.

section.title: cvs
section.p: References the repository in which this project resides. May also contain various overrides.

tr.td: The name of the repository in which this module resides.
Additional information which will be added in the front of the host name. Useful for repositories like sorceforge which define a separate virtual host for every project
The subdirectory in which the cvs module is present. Useful for repositories like developerworks which organize related modules into directories.
An override for the name of the cvs module.
No. Defaults to the name of the module.
Set the compression level. Some CVS client/server combinations will not work with compression.
No. Defaults to the compress value for the repository

section.title: svn
section.p: References the Subversion repository in which this project resides. May also contain various overrides.

tr.td: The name of the repository in which this module resides.
The subdirectory in which the svn module is present. Useful for repositories like Apache's which organize related modules into directories.

section.title: p4
section.p: References a Perforce repository in which this project resides.

tr.td: The name of the repository in which this module resides.

section.title: git
section.p: References the Git repository in which this project resides. May also contain various overrides.

tr.td: The name of the repository in which this module resides.
The subdirectory in which the git module is present. Useful for repositories which organize related modules into directories.
Remote git branch to pull from.
Setting either of these attributes to "true" removes --quiet flag from git commands.

section.title: darcs
section.p: References the darcs repository in which this project resides. May also contain various overrides.

tr.td: The name of the repository in which this module resides.
The subdirectory in which the darcs module is present. Useful for repositories which organize related modules into directories.

section.title: bzr
section.p: References the Bazaar repository in which this project resides. May also contain various overrides.

tr.td: The name of the repository in which this module resides.
The subdirectory in which the bzr module is present. Useful for repositories which organize related modules into directories.

section.title: hg
section.p: References the Mercurial repository in which this project resides. May also contain various overrides.

tr.td: The name of the repository in which this module resides.
The subdirectory in which the hg module is present. Useful for repositories which organize related modules into directories.

section.title: project
section.p: A definition of a project which is physically contained in this module.

section.title: redistributable
section.p: If present, indicates that outputs of builds from this module are redistributable. Defaults to the redistributable value for the repository.
